Climate activists block Amsterdam highway in protest against INGDutch climate activists on Saturday blocked a major highway in Amsterdam to demand an immediate end to the financing of fossil fuel projects by lender ING . Sat, 30 Dec 2023 12:40:11 GMT ABCRCMT5VVJRHLYNALZIBCQOII https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/climate-activists-block-amsterdam-highway-protest-against-ing-2023-12-30/Reuters可持续发展缔约方大会第二十八届会议
Pakistan election body rejects ex-PM Imran Khan's nomination for 2024 electionsPakistan's election body has rejected former Prime Minister Imran Khan's nomination to contest the 2024 national elections in two constituencies, officials and his party's media team said on Saturday. Sat, 30 Dec 2023 12:11:11 GMT HQ4AGOISTFJ43OS46RCAOMDQTU https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/pakistan-election-body-rejects-ex-pm-imran-khans-nomination-2024-elections-2023-12-30/Reuters世界亚太地区
Flooded tunnel near London disrupts Eurostar train servicesFlooding in a railway tunnel near London forced the cancellation of more than a dozen trains linking Britain with the European mainland early on Saturday, international rail operator Eurostar said. Sat, 30 Dec 2023 11:15:37 GMT HSM3ZHMEQFJ3NE3ESN4SCFTSIQ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/flooded-tunnel-near-london-disrupts-eurostar-train-services-2023-12-30/Reuters世界欧洲
China to boost activity to assert sovereignty over East China Sea islets, Kyodo reportsChinese President Xi Jinping has instructed the coast guard to strengthen its activities to assert sovereignty over the East China islets, which are controlled by Tokyo but also claimed by Beijing, Japan's Kyodo news agency reported on Saturday. Sat, 30 Dec 2023 11:12:16 GMT HODYAK2X3RJUNANZKVY2EP3QRM https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/china-boost-activity-assert-sovereignty-over-east-china-sea-islets-kyodo-2023-12-30/Reuters世界亚太地区
Hooked on volcanoes? Tourists vie to catch Iceland's eruptionsAs the glowing river of lava from a volcano that erupted last week in Iceland ebbed, not everyone was happy. Poland resumes ground search after Friday airspace breachPolish military officials said the object, suspected to be a Russian rocket, left the country's airspace within three minutes of entry from the direction of its border with Ukraine. Sat, 30 Dec 2023 10:21:54 GMT OJQW37KGDVPZZOK5IMLWX5NHBY https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/poland-resumes-ground-search-after-friday-airspace-breach-army-2023-12-30/Reuters世界欧洲
Taiwan's sovereignty belongs to its people, presidential frontrunner saysTaiwan's sovereignty and independence belong to its people, the frontrunner to be its next president said on Saturday in an often testy debate with the other two candidates dominated by arguments over China and tensions in the Taiwan Strait. Malaysia anti-graft body probes ex-finance minister for abuse of power, money launderingMalaysia's anti-graft agency said on Saturday it was investigating a former finance minister and key ally of ex-Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad under the country's abuse of power and money laundering laws. Top court upholds Paris decision to reserve student residences for Olympics workersParis's university housing body is allowed to reserve more than 2,000 student apartments for Olympics workers next summer, France's highest administrative court ruled on Friday after a lower court initially suspended the measure. Venezuelan magnate Gustavo Cisneros dead at 78Cisneros on Friday announced the death of its chairman, Gustavo Cisneros Rendiles, who was aged 78. It did not provide further details.
